factoid: The general had a fit of coughing as a result of shouting and of the powder smoke
The general stopped in despair
Everything seemed lost
The French who were attacking suddenly ran back and disappeared from the outskirts
Russian sharpshooters showed themselves in the copse
Timókhin’s company alone had maintained its order in the wood
Timókhin’s company had lain in ambush in a ditch
Timókhin’s company attacked the French unexpectedly
Timókhin was armed only with a sword
Timókhin rushed at the enemy with a desperate cry
Timókhin rushed at the enemy with mad, drunken determination
The French were taken by surprise
The French threw down their muskets
The French ran
Dólokhov was running beside Timókhin
Dólokhov killed a Frenchman at close quarters
Dólokhov was the first to seize the surrendering French officer by his collar
Our fugitives returned
The battalions re-formed
The French who had nearly cut our left flank in half were for the moment repulsed
Our reserve units joined up
The fight ended
The regimental commander and Major Ekonómov stopped beside a bridge
The regimental commander and Major Ekonómov let the retreating companies pass by them
A soldier came up and took hold of the commander’s stirrup
The soldier was almost leaning against the commander
The soldier was wearing a bluish coat of broadcloth
The soldier had no knapsack
The soldier had no cap
The soldier's head was bandaged
A French munition pouch was slung over the soldier's shoulder
The soldier had an officer’s sword in his hand
The soldier was pale
The soldier's blue eyes looked impudently into the commander’s face
The soldier's lips were smiling
The commander was occupied in giving instructions to Major Ekonómov
The commander took notice of the soldier
Dólokhov said, "Your excellency, here are two trophies"
Dólokhov pointed to the French sword and pouch
Dólokhov said, "I have taken an officer prisoner"
Dólokhov said, "I stopped the company"
Dólokhov breathed heavily from weariness
Dólokhov spoke in abrupt sentences
Dólokhov said, "The whole company can bear witness"
Dólokhov said, "I beg you will remember this, your excellency"
The commander replied, "All right, all right"
The commander turned to Major Ekonómov
Dólokhov did not go away
Dólokhov untied the handkerchief around his head
Dólokhov pulled the handkerchief off
Dólokhov showed the blood congealed on his hair
Dólokhov said, "A bayonet wound"
Dólokhov said, "I remained at the front"
Dólokhov said, "Remember, your excellency"
Túshin’s battery had been forgotten
At the very end of the action, Prince Bagratión sent his orderly staff officer to order the battery to retire quickly
Prince Bagratión was still hearing the cannonade in the center
Later Prince Andrew also sent his orderly staff officer to order the battery to retire quickly
The supports attached to Túshin’s battery had been moved away in the middle of the action by someone’s order
The battery continued firing after the supports were moved away
The battery was not captured by the French
The French could not surmise that anyone could continue firing from four quite undefended guns
The energetic action of the battery led the French to suppose that the main Russian forces were concentrated in the center
The French had attempted to attack the center twice
Each time the French were driven back by grapeshot from the four isolated guns on the hillock
Soon after Prince Bagratión left Túshin, Túshin set fire to Schön Grabern
The artillerymen exclaimed, "Look at them scurrying! It’s burning! Just see the smoke! Fine! Grand! Look at the smoke, the smoke!"
All the guns fired in the direction of the conflagration without waiting for orders
The soldiers cried, "Fine! That’s good! Look at it... Grand!" at each shot
The fire was fanned by the breeze
The fire was rapidly spreading
The French columns that had advanced beyond the village went back
The enemy placed ten guns to the right of the village
The enemy began firing those ten guns at Túshin’s battery
